Summary Note:
Janssen Maassen Wagemakers and the RM crossed paths at a tech conference in Amsterdam. They attended several keynote sessions together and realized they had a shared vision for the future of technology investments.
Janssen Maassen Wagemakers is a seasoned professional with over 19 years of experience.
He decided to join Julius Baer for its renowned wealth management services and personalized client approach.
Family Background: Janssen Maassen Wagemakers is currently single. He does not have any children.
Education Background:
Janssen earned his secondary school diploma from Hervormd Lyceum Zutphen in 2001.
Janssen graduated from Erasmus University Rotterdam in 2005, completing his higher education.
In 2010, he received extra education and graduated from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam - School of Business and Economics with an additional degree.
Occupation History:
Having worked for over 19 years, Janssen Maassen Wagemakers brings a wealth of experience and expertise to his current role. He is known for his strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
Janssen Maassen Wagemakers began his professional journey as a Stockbroker at APG Asset Management N.V. in 2006, laying the foundation for future success.
At PGGM Investments, he held the position of Portfolio Manager from 2012 to 2015, making significant contributions to the organization.
His tenure as a Hedge Fund Manager at Robeco Institutional Asset Management B.V. from 2017 till now was marked by significant achievements and a deepening understanding of the field.
Wealth Summary:
He managed to save approximately 200000 EUR from his earnings at all companies.
He owns house in Doetinchem, where he resides. It is worth 17000000 EUR.


Following the passing of his mother, a successful Hedge Fund Manager, he received an inheritance of 220000 EUR in 2014, which he has used to secure his financial future.
Client Summary: In conclusion, we are confident in the client's financial stability and future prospects.
